definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: In the locker room I pull off my clothes and take a one-minute shower.
sentences.chinese: 我在更衣室脱下了衣服，冲了一分钟澡。

sentences.english: He, Jean Valjean, had made her abandon those rags to clothe herself in these mourning habiliments.
sentences.chinese: 是他冉阿让，使她脱下了这褴褛的衣服，换上了孝服。

sentences.english: What do you do when you think you're blown off your path?
sentences.chinese: 你怎么做的时候，你认为你吹脱下自己的路？

sentences.english: A third debated whether to take off her burka.
sentences.chinese: 第三个女孩正在为是否需要脱下她的布卡尔而争论着。

sentences.english: He pulled off his gloves, took out his matches, and lighted the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他脱下了自己的手套，掏出了火柴，点燃了火苗。

sentences.english: Removing her skirt, she then asked Gessen to do another picture on the back of her petticoat.
sentences.chinese: 说着她脱下衬裙，让月仙在里子那一面再画一幅。

sentences.english: It is chilly outside, change the thin overcoat with thick one.
sentences.chinese: 外面很冷，脱下薄外套穿上一件厚的。

sentences.english: I took off my shoes and hung my clothes on the stepladder.
sentences.chinese: 我脱下鞋子，把衣服挂在梯子上。

sentences.english: Out is quite cold, put on a thick coat instead of the thin one.
sentences.chinese: 外面很冷，脱下薄外套穿上一件厚的。

sentences.english: I let my pants drop, then took off my shirt and panties.
sentences.chinese: 我脱下了裤子，然后是衬衫和内裤。

sentences.english: She took off the smock and stood there in a bright green slip.
sentences.chinese: 她脱下工作服，穿上一件鲜绿色调的衬裙站在那里。

sentences.english: He undressed and stepped into the pool.

sentences.chinese: 把第一双袜子从脚上脱下。

sentences.english: So he took off his clothes and dive to the water.
sentences.chinese: 于是他脱下衣服，潜到水里。

sentences.english: He gets his shirt off, spins it through the air over his head, flings the shirt away.
sentences.chinese: 他拿着脱下来的衬衣在头顶上挥舞着扔出。

definition: to remove/to take off/to strip off/to discard/to shed/to come off/to fall off
to take off (trousers)/to drop one's pants
to put on (clothes)/to put (clothes) back on
